1.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.

1.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular
1.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
Present participle of archo; a first.
Of Hebrew origin; a separatist, i.e. Exclusively religious; a Pharisean, i.e. Jewish sectary.

1.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Plural

1.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

1.str2: To watch, observe scrupulously. From para and tereo; to inspect alongside, i.e. Note insidiously or scrupulously.

From en and pros; in front of (literally or figuratively) or time).

3.str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

4.str2: To lay hold of, take hold of, seize (sometimes with beneficent, sometimes with hostile, intent).

An ox, cow, bull. Probably from the base of bosko; an ox, i.e. An animal of that species.

A pit, well, cistern. Of uncertain derivation; a hole in the ground, i.e. A cistern or well; figuratively, an abyss.

Immediately, soon, at once. Adverb from euthus; directly, i.e. At once or soon.

33.str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

33.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
33.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

34.str2: Salt. From hals; salt; figuratively, prudence.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Salt. From hals; salt; figuratively, prudence.

34.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
34.str2: From moros; to become insipid; figuratively, to make as a simpleton.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

34.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Dative Neuter Singular
34.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

34.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
34.str2: Prop: I arrange, make ready; I season, flavor. From a presumed derivative of airo; to prepare, i.e. Spice.

35.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
35.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Suitable, fit, useful. From eu and a derivative of tithemi; well placed, i.e. appropriate.
And not, neither, nor. From ou and te; not too, i.e. Neither or nor; by analogy, not even.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.
And not, neither, nor. From ou and te; not too, i.e. Neither or nor; by analogy, not even.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Manure; a dung-hill. From kopros; manure.

35.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Neuter 3rd Person Singular
35.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

35.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
35.str2: (a) I cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: I place, put, drop. A primary verb; to throw.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

35.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
35.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
(a) the ear, (b) met: the faculty of perception. Apparently a primary word; the ear.
To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

35.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
35.str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
